name: Payment by buyer before inspection
text:
(1)  Where the contract requires payment before inspection nonconformity of the goods does not excuse the buyer from so making payment unless



	(a)	The nonconformity appears without inspection; or
	(b)	Despite tender of the required documents the circumstances would justify injunction against honor under this chapter (section 490:5-109(b)).



	(2)  Payment pursuant to subsection (1) does not constitute an acceptance of goods or impair the buyer's right to inspect or any of the buyer's remedies. [L 1965, c 208, §2-512; HRS ; am L 1996, c 39, §3; gen ch 2000]
